There are also five things that enable a woman to quickly attain the state of a man and reach supreme, perfect enlightenment.
What are the five things?

third, to hear the Dharma and abide in it directly;
fourth, to not delight in the female body;
fifth, to contemplate becoming a man.

third, to be sincere;
fourth, to be free from flattery;
fifth, to be without pretense;

What are the seven?
First, always contemplate the Dharma body of the Buddha;

third, always contemplate the Sangha, as the future retinue;
fourth, always contemplate the precepts, in order to attain purity;
fifth, always contemplate giving, in order to remove all defilements;
sixth, always contemplate the heavens, in order to arouse the mind of a bodhisattva;
seventh, always contemplate sentient beings, in order to deliver all.
These are the seven things.

What are the nine?

Second, having nothing to which to become attached;
Third, having no self;
Fourth, not thinking of there being a person;
Fifth, not thinking of there being a life;

Seventh, not thinking of where one has been born;
Eighth, not thinking of where one has not been born;
Ninth, only being apart from the twelve links of dependent origination.
These are the nine things.

What are the ten?

Second, not coveting anything belonging to others;
Third, not thinking of the bodies of other men;
Fourth, not engaging in gossip;

Eighth, not taking pleasure in others' entertainment;
